Title: wonderful monitors
Content: it's been some years since using any monitors as i use dt770 250's for all my audio work and wow, i'm so pleased i added these to my studio...first the sound...the sound is quite flat which is good as you can accurately eq your sound. the bass is "even", meaning that it's there but it's not exaggerated. the mids are very well balanced (they sound great) and the high end is also fairly well balanced and you can get some nice air and snap when eqing. for those that have the bayer dynamic dt770 250's, you'll find your headphones have more "air" and snap a bit more in the highs by default, the lower mids probably have a little more punch, but not much. going back and forth between the 770's and the monitors should be a similar(ish) experience...build quality and size..very petit in size, they don't take up much room. the build is absolutely fine for the price. no issues there...you have standard connections by means of speaker wire and phono to 3.5mm (unbalanced). i'd recommend using some trs to trs to help eliminate noise from emf...on the backs you also have access to bass and treble knobs to help tune the sound to your room...on the front you have the power switch and 3.5mm ports for headphones and phone so you can play music from your phone via the correct cable, usually 3.5mm to 3.5mm. just note that the headphone in isn't powerful enough to power 250ohm headphones...overall, these monitors are brilliant and well worth the price.

Title: crackling sound when connected to bluetooth
Content: i‚Äôd like to preface this review by saying i tried 2 different sets of these speakers (both the bluetooth version), brand new, and both had the exact same issue, so must be a model issue rather than a one-off problem...the first pair i bought had a constant crackling/buzzing noise coming from the passive speaker when connected to bluetooth. the noise disappeared when disconnected from bluetooth, but appeared instantly when connected. it was audible at low volumes which ruined the listening experience so i exchanged for another set...this second set had the exact same problem. i tried connecting a different bluetooth device, i tried moving the speakers to different rooms, moving electrical devices away, swapping cables around‚Ä¶ but the noise would not disappear no matter what i tried...really disappointing and has massively turned me away from purchasing presonus products again...i started the returns process on 2nd may 2023, posted the item the same day, and still have not had a refund - today is 12th may 2023. would love an update on my refund please?

Title: everything you've ever wanted - best sound ever.
Content: presonus e5bt incredible clear sound. these reference speakers are absolutely brilliant for a desktop setup with a laptop or desktop computer. ideal for small studios. the e5bt gives excellent sound, has lots of functionality, is easy to setup, a pleasure to use. everything you could want is on the front of the left speaker ‚Äì power, volume, line in, phones out, & bt5 that works very well ‚Äì easy connect anything. the 5 inch driver gives a full clear sound & the rear port adds a solid accurate bass response. eq as flat as a pancake. only the left speaker is actively amped, the right is passive. the amp jumps in output to 50w in the 5‚Äôs & is better quality - the 3 & 4 inch are 25w. uniquely there‚Äôs a trs sub-out which is nice, so connecting a sub is quick, easy & cheap. they are rear ported so they need some space ‚Äì not bang up against a brick wall. basic acoustic modeling for the chosen speaker position is possible with controls at the rear of the speaker - see end of post for studio setup. for the lowest volumes you‚Äôll need to cut the line volume. the freebie music software is a distraction, so don‚Äôt waste your time - get ableton..the e5bt‚Äôs quality & clarity makes music production a dream. you can hear every detail, so every track can be picked out, modified & levels accurately set. dump the cables supplied in the box & get some good quality shielded cable connectors. tisino make a trs stereo splitter cable from amazon - a good choice for a basic direct computer connection with a 3.5 jack. all line voltages should be well shielded or you risk interference, hum, crosstalk. as with all pro speakers its good practice to switch the power to the speakers - off first - on last - accidental pops & explosive cracks do damage..these are near field but it‚Äôs worth getting the 5 inch as there is no substitute for shifting lots of air ‚Äì the 5‚Äôs have a full solid bass & double the amp power, so you get lots of headroom before distortion. they are good value for money. these speak

Title: did not like at first?
Content: these are near-field monitor speakers designed to have a flat frequency response. this means they need to be closer to you at near-ear height, with speaker separation dependent on distance to form that optimum triangle you complete in the recommended listening position. unlike consumer speakers with eq set at speaker level, these provide an uncoloured flat eq response. this gives a more accurate representation of the input sound source, so now you can mix your audio without adding any unwanted eq bias. straight out of the box and not tuned to my room acoustics, i didn't like they were slightly bass heavy due to the lower frequencies of sound reflecting off walls. i tweaked the bass by -1 db and the treble by +1 db, the result is now perfect for my purposes. the bluetooth connectivity is just a convenient function for me, the front on/off switch, volume control, aux in and headphones out are great design features. i recommend using the balanced trs inputs. the build quality of this product is excellent. don't forget to register for software downloads and a handy setup tutorial.
Clean Content: near-field monitor speakers designed flat frequency response. means need closer near-ear height, speaker separation dependent distance form optimum triangle complete recommended listening position. unlike consumer speakers eq set speaker level, provide uncoloured flat eq response. gives accurate representation input sound source, mix audio without adding unwanted eq bias. straight box not tuned room acoustics, didn't like slightly bass heavy due lower frequencies sound reflecting walls. tweaked bass -1 db treble +1 db, result perfect purposes. bluetooth connectivity convenient function me, front on/off switch, volume control, aux headphones great design features. recommend using balanced trs inputs. build quality product excellent. forget register software downloads handy setup tutorial.

Title: virtually unusable due to signal noise
Content: tl;dr: don‚Äôt buy this subwoofer; it‚Äôs a terrible product that hums and hisses...i really wanted to love this subwoofer, but it‚Äôs basically unusable due to all the noise:..- it always hums when it‚Äôs powered on, even if it‚Äôs not connected to anything. another reviewer mentioned that‚Äôs a problem with the transformer and they fixed it by adding some padding to the transformer themselves. i can‚Äôt confirm: i don‚Äôt have such technical skills and i don‚Äôt think i should be expected to fix such things myself; could be a fire hazard!.- it introduces hissing noises to my eris 3.5 speakers when connected to my computer, even if i use an an external dac. these speakers do not pick up noise if i connect them to my computer directly without the subwoofer..- it introduces hissing noises to my eris 3.5 speakers when connected to my macbook every time i use my magic trackpad or magic keyboard. again, the eris 3.5 speakers do not hiss if not connected through the subwoofer...i have tried resolving the issue by using a power conditioner, and by trying different combinations of devices, cables, and wall sockets, but no joy. none of my other audio products have this problem. i can only conclude that this product has some some faulty or just plain bad electronics inside, maybe the transformer or amplifier...on the rare moments i got it to work without producing too much noise (apart from the hum) for a few moments it seemed to produce good sound, although i am no audiophile.

Title: the best budget monitors
Content: these studio monitors definitely punch above their weight. having previously owned various sub-¬£100 monitors, i was expecting these to do the job but not blow me away. when i set them up i found the sound flat and clear - perfect for mixing...paired with a speaker eq software such as soundid, i've found that i don't feel like i need to upgrade these in the next few years...one benefit for me is that they don't use much power - i have a small room with only 1 plug socket so needed speakers that won't overload the socket. they get quite loud but those with larger rooms may want to opt for the next size up.

Title: so happy with this purchase ;)
Content: now i'm a cheapskate.... i needed to replace the cheap pc speakers i was using, so i opted for the cheapest pc speakers on amazon. big mistake. now i'm no audiophile, but these were terrible tinny speakers, and i couldn't bear listening to them a moment longer, so i sent them back immediately!..then i ordered these presonus studio monitors, and even though they were about 5x as expensive as the previous speakers they are 100% worth it!! these are simply awesome speakers, definitely the best speakers i have ever owned! they're a little larger than the average pc speakers, and you will need to also buy some quality phono leads to connect them to a pc, but the sound quality is superb and there is absolutely no hum or extraneous noise no matter how close the cables are to other electronics. one of the best purchases i ever made on amazon :)

Title: arrived damaged.
Content: i was after a set of smaller monitors for my desktop video editing setup on a recommendation from a friend who has a set, and these fit the bill perfectly. they're loud (surprisingly so!), compact and discreet sat next to my monitors. the sound would normally be excellent i'm sure of it, but unfortunately, the bass woofer on the right side speaker is rattling, even at lower volumes, and there's a distinct rattle when you shake the speaker, so i would assume it's a transit issue. i've mounted the speakers on isolation pads and there's nothing on my desk to cause the noise and the louder you put them, the louder the noise is, so it's definitely the speaker. my friend's setup is pretty much identical to mine, and his sound superb, so i know they're great little monitors, but it's unfortunate that mine are damaged on arrival. not sure who to speak to about this issue either, so i'll just have to listen at extremely low volume for now until i can find out who to contact...other than the fact that mine are broken, listening to my friend's speakers, these have a nice flat frequency response and are deserving of their #1 spot at the top of the most bought studio monitors on the amazon lists. they're a great little set of speakers for anything from gaming, to podcasting to av production. they're not bluetooth enabled speakers, which wasn't on my must-have list anyway, but i have them hooked up to my computer via balanced inputs taken from an ifi zen dac, which sounds superb in it's own right...all in all, a nice little set of super-compact speakers. just a shame about the damage.

Title: pairs beautifully
Content: well, it took three goes and boy; that is less than ideal...first two had issues and i think the second sub was a return if i‚Äôm being honest...the thing to watch with this kind of device, anything actively powered, the inbuilt power aspect can cause vibration. the second sub i ordered had a terrible hum which i reduced by getting the volume balanced between the eris 4.5s and the sub and the interface for my mac..the first sub just stopped producing bass; which i sent back no issue but the second sun was faulty and the return window much smaller. it went ‚Äúpop‚Äù the day the return window closed and although a bit of a pain, going back between amazon and presonus, amazon replaced the sub...third time is definitely a charm. the 4.5 and sub pair fantastically...i‚Äôm mainly working with logic pro and the clarity and depth makes production difficult because of how much fun i‚Äôm having exploring sound...the bass on this unit is deeeeeeeeeeeeep. it fills my living room and i doubt i‚Äôll ever push the unit. don‚Äôt think i need to...the bass is punchy, tight and kicks bottom...i‚Äôm sure many people have had an easier time and despite trouble getting this purchase off the ground i‚Äôm thrilled i finally did...if you‚Äôre interested in the monitor sub combo, be assured it‚Äôs great...once again, i‚Äôm using the eris 4.5 (not bt) and sub 8 and for 300 you‚Äôd be pushed to find better...frankly amazing it‚Äôs this clear and powerful at that price.

Title: no nonsense speakers with impressive sound quality
Content: i saw these speakers on a youtuber's desk setup and he was raving about them. so i figured i'd give them a bash...i was using the built in speaker on my macbook or my monitor. both i found were similar in quality and i felt sound was ok. nothing spectacular but i felt ok given i'm not a audiophile. it gets the job done and i can listen to youtube and spotify ok...so i was curious how i would find the speakers and if i'd resent the extra space it takes on my desk. i've spent a lot of time/money making the desk as minimal as possible. so to plonk two speakers on the desk felt a little unnecessary. i didn't want to spend crazy money so these speakers seemed to fit the bill...when they arrived i carefully opened the box, unwrapped everything and plugged everything in. half convinced they'd be returned soon. i turned them on, loaded up a music video on youtube.......and boom! instantly i realised these speakers would not be going back. the sound quality is incredible! the music just came alive, i could hear so much more!..i love the styling of them, simple and understated. the front power button makes it easy for me to turn on/off without having to reach around the back...sound is not bass heavy like some headphones i've used in the past. this is important as sometimes my wife edits video so we need accuracy on the sound...i'm really struggling to think of anything negative to say so i won't!..at this price, they are an absolute steal! just get them and be happy!

Title: good speakers with a few reservations
Content: i've only just connected these speakers to my pc (for music, streaming, etc as opposed to gaming) so these are my first impressions...the sound is pretty good for the speaker size. there is good bass without it being overwhelming (i've increased the bass slightly). i was slightly worried before buying them that i might need to buy a separate cable to connect to my pc, but this proved not to be the case - everything was included (though the instructions were not - see below)...there are a few things that could be improved on:..1. perhaps they are not the best looking speakers - at first i thought there were a bit "boxy" and square, but i've changed my mind and quite like their chunkiness. however, for a desktop set up it would be better to have them angled upwards...2. the volume control doesn't have any markings so you can't tell how far you've turned it apart from the sound - it would be better to have a visual marker...3. bass and treble controls (for some reason presonus don't refer to them as bass and treble which are terms everyone understands!) are awkwardly located at the back of the left speaker...4. documentation is pretty poor. the startup guide and user guide (neither of which were in the box - i had to register the product to get them) is no help for anyone with no specialist audio skills just hooking up to a pc: it doesn't show how to do this, and the terminology might be fine for sound engineers and dedicated gamers but not for your average pc user. i had to look for online tutorials to take me through it step by step...these small reservations aside, i'm very happy with them.

Title: these speakers are pretty bad
Content: i wanted a small pair of best selling speakers for space saving reasons and to compare my mixes against my adam a77x...first off these speakers are in no way professional monitors and any photograph or review telling you otherwise is simply marketing hype and straight up lies. if you do want pro sound from your speakers expect to pay 1k upwards...these speakers are pretty bad in terms of sound quality dispersing alot of reverberation from the cabinets...if your buying these don't buy them in order to get a professional sound. get them because you need a pair of not exactly cheap but convenient speakers.

Title: excellent speakers for the price!
Content: these are really good reference speakers, the highs and mids are really clear and the bass is present, but nice and tight, the bass compliments the speakers instead of drowning everything out...basically you get what you put into these speakers, upgrade your wires and connectors, instead of what comes in the box, and boy do these speakers respond!..you hear what you're supposed to with these speakers, if there's bass in the mix then tight bass is what you get, likewise if there's little to no bass in your mix then you won't hear it as strong, these speakers do not 'colour' your sound, they faithfully reproduce whatever your main music source is...for the size and the price point they are excellent speakers..i would highly recommend them!

Title: excellent sound for the price if you can tolerate an ever-present quiet hiss
Content: there is a constant hiss coming from the speakers. it is not particularly loud but it is present regardless of if the volume is turned all the way down or not, and above around 70% volume the hiss gets louder. it is not affected by any adjustments to volume from the source (pc) and the hiss is still present even when there are no cables other than the power attached...that being said, i do not know whether this is normal for a pair of speakers like this. i upgraded from a pair of creative gigaworks t40 speakers, which had a noticeable hum and hiss above 50% volume. this hiss from these presonus eris e4.5 bt speakers is much quieter and it took me about 3 days to even notice it. i am sensitive to what might be considered to be annoying noises, but i do not consider the hiss to be particularly obnoxious or annoying - in fact, with my tinnitus it is almost comforting. it's not a dealbreaker for me, but this is still something potential buyers may wish to know and consider before committing to purchasing these speakers...as for the quality of the audio from these speakers, they really are a huge step up from the aforementioned creative t40s. it seemed at first that there wasn't much bass, but after turning up the low end frequencies on the acoustic tuning controls i can say with confidence that these speakers can produce ample amounts of bass. just keep in mind that adjusting these controls can defeat the point of using the speakers as reference monitors since certain frequencies will become enhanced or stifled depending on how you set them...overall a great pair of speakers, only marred by the quiet hiss that i now find impossible not to notice. not a dealbreaker for me, though, and i'm still satisfied with them for the price.

Title: great subwoofer, however needs slight modification
Content: good sounding subwoofer, works nicely with the eris 3.5 speakers. however i noticed there was a fairly loud humming noise coming from the transformer...transformers make noise by nature however it was quite loud in this sub. i believe it was being caused from the transformer vibrations resonating through the case of the sub due to a poor mount between the case and the transformer...after reading a review also mentioning this i ended up re-mounting the transformer with some anti vibration washers then using some cable ties to support it. after doing this, the sub is now silent...warning only attempt this if you are ok with voiding the warranty on this device.

Title: very good clarity, vocals and even bass sound better than expected
Content: after lots of research got it down to two sets for consideration, these and the edifier r1700bt, after many video reviews and careful listening, i preferred how the bass sounded on the edifier r1700bt, but the rest sounded a little muddy, the presonus eris e4.5 sound more clear but lacked the same bass sound the edifier r1700bt produced, hard to tell for sure via youtube review over your own headset for sure, perfect world would have liked to had the two on my desk to review, but as it goes the bass sound better on the presonus eris e4.5 than i was expecting so more than happy with my choice, just spend some time positioning them and you seating positioning to find that sweet spot and you won't be disappointed...get some decent foam pads to seat them on as on your desk you will get unwanted vibrations, and if like me you have you pc in a enclosed confined space then some eq acoustics premium acoustic foam tiles will help with unwanted echo and reverberation, more important if you do audio mixing or recordings than if you just play games.

Title: amazing price/quality ratio
Content: i wasn't expecting much for the price (although the glowing reviews hinted at some good potential), but these sound absolutely fantastic. i haven't tried them for mixing yet, but for general listening they compare very, very favourably to a pair of rokits i had for a long time (bearing in mind the obvious difference in woofer size). they just sound clear, natural but still punchy. without any overbearing frequencies. perhaps a bit tight overall, but i would expect that to mellow out as the cones break in. excellent small footprint on a desk as well. overall, these are an absolute steal, and are head and shoulders above your typical pc speakers for not that much more money.

Title: great desktop speakers for a clear sparkling reproduction of music
Content: after much deliberation i bought these for my office at work to listen to music at lower levels (and not so low when most of the workforce has gone home). i did quite a bit of research and there were quite a few recommendations for these. the next option level up i was considering were over double the price...overall im very happy with them, they do lack a bit of low end, i find the audioengine a2's i have at some while smaller have quite a bit more punch and low end, however, they don't image nearly as well as these and the mid and top end is much better with these imo. im playing these through a fiio dac...build quality is ok. they are plastic enclosures which feel a bit light and cheap to me, but i just weigh them down a bit with some heavy ornaments on top of them...i would buy them again for the money, but if you want a bit of bass then perhaps looks elsewhere (or turn it up with the eq controls).

Title: probably the best speakers for less than ¬£100.
Content: i quite like these speakers. they are not your usual drowned mids/artificial bass boost bookshelf speakers., instead they are trying to be faithful to the source. i think they perform fairly well both for music listening and movies/videogames, while they still give you a lot of information if you want to do some music production. not bad at all, considering they are as tiny as 3.5" speakers can get, saving you a lot of space on your desk...apart from sounding great, they pack some nice features that are not that easy to find at this category. things like optional trs outputs, kevlar woofer, aux-in and headphones ports really make the eris 3.5 stand out from most budget speakers. the two eq knobs on the back for fixing some audio space related issues are also a welcome addition...i know it might be much to ask at this price, but the included pads could be a bit thicker. i am also missing an auto power-saving mode like the krk's, or at least an option to turn off the power led. i went for the 3.5'' because i really wanted the smaller possible, but they obviously come with some limitations when it comes to sound, especially on the lower frequencies. i would strongly suggest looking at the 4.5" ones (or bigger) if space is not an issue or if they are to be used exclusively for music production...in a nutshell, if you want small speakers on a budget that still stay relatively accurate and sound great, this is probably your best bet.

Title: great pair of speakers
Content: presonus eris e4.5..arrive in a nice box with a power lead, small jack to phono (which is typically what you need to connect them to a pc or portable device), and a length of speak wire to connect the two speakers together. i didn‚Äôt measure any of the leads but most of them are about 1.5m and the speaker wire is about 1.8m. the speaker wire is nothing special, no propitiatory plugs on the end, so easy to replace if you need something longer...i bought these as a pair of computer speakers. having tried a number of different makes, i wanted something that didn‚Äôt mess with the sound so much. these are just great. very neutral. of course they are best for music. with games, it really doesn‚Äôt matter much what speakers you use, they all sound pretty good. who knows what the game is supposed to sound like anyway? with movies and so on, they sound good but i generally find that any source on the internet sounds ‚Äúnot that great‚Äù and the speakers are capable of something more...i like the addition of a mains switch on the front, volume control, led and a few sockets for input (aux) and output (headphones). it‚Äôs particularly useful to be able to set the max volume on the knob and just leave it alone ‚Äì using the computer volume from there on. the led is relatively dim so unobtrusive, especially from any other angle other that dead on...the speakers use eight watts doing nothing and mine refused to go in to standby mode. i sat there for two hours and nothing. now i know that eight watts is not much but my speakers needed to be on twenty four hours a day which adds up to seventy kilowatt hours per year. that's hopeless. i don't want to deduct a star for that but just be warned, you really need to turn them off! some people complained about the standby so perhaps they have disabled it now? don't know. couldn't find any information about that...i compared these directly to a pair of edifier, and i have to say that the edifier were probably better for most people. they were more liv

Title: vast improvement on cheap pc speakers
Content: my logitech z506 5.1 pc sound system served me well for a decade but finally decided to stop working. as a temporary measure i set up the dell pc speakers that had come with the system, and was shocked at how bad they were were! i was about to buy the z607 speaker system, as being the nearest direct replacement to the z506, when i spotted a recommendation on the internet to try the presonus eris e3.5 instead. i was a bit dubious about "downgrading" to just stereo speakers, but i had long stopped using the rear speakers of the z506 as they didn't give true surround sound and locating them correctly and running the wires safely was always a problem. also, i rarely had the subwoofer turned up that rapidly gained complaints from the rest of the family! anyway, the eris speakers are very easy to setup, the sound is as good - if not better - than the old z506, and general setup is tidier, with no sub-woofer or centre speaker. if you are demanding music connoisseur or have a high-end gaming rig then look else where, but for the average home user looking for a simple solution that will provide decent but not exceptional sound at a relatively low price - definitely an option to consider seriously.

Title: excellent value for money - audiophile review
Content: so i think these are the cheapest single bit of audio equipment i own. i wanted something to use at my desktop for monitoring my guitar playing without breaking the bank...i have a ¬£600 hifi setup, good iem's and open back headphones, and all things considered i think these are really good value for money...resolution (ability for them to reproduce detail in music).- good (for the money). you won't be able to discern lossy vs lossless music with these. not even close. however they hold their own. the detail in the midrange is pretty good. high end clarity is lost a little. for the money, i'd not expect much more than this...range of frequencies.- well, they're 3-inch monitors. of course they wont produce floor shaking sub-bass. for example in billy eilish - your power. the sub bass wubwub bits starting at 2.45 are barely audible, or at least there is no weight to the sound at all...tuning.- it seems pretty 'flat' to me for the frequencies it produces, however, of course this is nowhere near a full-range sound (as discussed above) so it lacks the majority of bass below 60hz...soundstage and imaging (the ability for them to place certain sounds in space - front, back, left, right, up, down).- is fairly poor, narrow, however to be expected. this is something you only relly get with much more expensive speakers.- front/back and up/down imaging is where it falls off. there isnt much depth to the soundstage either. again, i must reiterate i wouldn't expect this at ¬£89...power (volume).- more than enough for any kind of small-medium room desktop listening which this is designed for. not a hifi system / room filling sound. but perfect for desktop use...connectivity.- excellent. whole range of options. personally i run from my audiointerface into the back using rca or trs and it works just fine. the idea of a powered and slave speaker makes more sense at this price...build quality.- great. i wouldn't really ask for any more than this at ¬£89. it's honestly quite impressive. t

Title: fantastic multimedia and gaming speakers
Content: i bought those to replace a set of creative gigaworks t40 ii's and creative t100's as i felt something was missing from the sound so i looked at those monitor speakers as they were discounted...i'm not an audiophile but i do like good sound and these speakers have it in spades. as soon as i swapped my old speakers off my desk, i was amazed by how much clearer and well better defined the sound was...although i dabble a bit with a midi controller with virtual instruments sometimes, i'm not a musician but i can see those being of use to some people who do create music on computer...the most surprising thing of all was the price, they were around the same price as the gigaworks t40 ii's when i bought them and cheaper than the creative t100s. although i'll keep a hold of the t40s as a spare set, i'll be getting rid of the t100s as i was never satisfied with them. for the price, this set are excellent value...i've tried them in games as well, i can hear footsteps and voices around buildings in some fps games that i've heard via headphones but never heard before on speakers so clearly. to sum it up, i'm very pleased with them!

Title: utter bargain
Content: i recently got back in music creation and bought a daw. up until then i relied on headphones which were great. but then i read it's best to have a 2nd reference, ie audio monitors for checking levels and such..didn't want to spend too much in case it became another one of many fads..i'm driving these with a presonus 24c audio interface, wired with singles trs cables instead of the rca cable they provide..for the money they sound pretty darn good, and loud too. the pack a lot of punch for there size and double up as great gaming speakers...the icing on the cake for me was buying a used/returned pair off amazon marketplace for ¬£66. they were described as having a deep scratch but when i checked them over. nothing, immaculate.

Title: presonus eris sub8 compact with gorgeous looks & average performance!
Content: after all the positive reviews about this product, i was so much looking forward to hooking this sub up to my system. however, i was at first very disappointed with the sound quality in general, because it did not deliver the window rattling, lound, punchy, low-end base like some other reviewers had suggested it did! having said that, the addition of this sub will actually drastically improve the overall low end frequencies when paired with the somewhat base-shy presonus e3.5 satellite speakers. for this reason i have to recommend this sub, but please don't expect ear shatteringly loud, punchy low end base because you won't get it! i have my system hooked up to my pc in a small office space just 5'x10' & mainly play music and i need both the sub & speakers set to almost max!.both hpf & 180 deg. swithes located on the rear of the unit make no difference to the sound whatsoever which is a little disappointing & the volume control is also located on the back which some people may also find a tad inconvenient..i was shocked when playing just the sub on its own (satellite speakers turned off) because the lower frequency base notes sounded not only very quiet, but muffled & distorted too! i was hoping for nice loud punchy low end base but didn't get it! having said that - when played together with the satellite speakers the overall sound does seem to come life!.don't be put off by this review because the overall sound is pretty good for the money & its usually true in what they say - "you get what you pay for"!

Title: good speakers for the price
Content: these look nice and are built well...the cables are fairly long. could be a little longer but long enough for most desks...the volume can go very loud without losing too much quality. louder than i will ever need...these are meant more for music people who want to hear things more accurately. this means that for music production the are pretty good but some things and voices in practically sound a bit off...they are okay for gaming as they have good bass and good sound quality although again, some things do sound a little off...most of these things are not that noticeable if you are not listing out for it though...they also angle sound very "straight". by this i mean if you are directly in front of the speakers they are very loud but if you step to the side you can notice a drop in volume. sound obvious but its more noticeable than with other speakers that i have used...all in all i think they are pretty good for the price and very good if you are using them for electric instruments or music production.

Title: a real review
Content: if you would like a small compact yet powerful set of speakers to be used in a small room, these are really good. however, if you're after something with a bit more kick in a slightly larger room then you should probably go for the 4.5 inch version as the 3.5 inch version really lack bass. i love the 3.5 inch version of the speakers but it does lack volume, they don't go very loud so if you're recording at low volume in your daw software playback will lack the volume that you so desire. the sound quality is good though...update:.just under a week and they're broken, there's a fuzzy noise coming from the left cone when a certain bass frequency has hit and it sounds garbage now!!!!

Title: outstanding for the price
Content: it‚Äôs been stated in other reviews that these speakers punch way above their price and size. i agree...the sound from the speakers is big and open. the tweeters provide really great rendition on all sorts of cymbals and the set up picks up all guitars, pianos, violins and cellos, brass, reed and vocals and provides a remarkably authentic, clipping free level of fidelity for their price and size...if they have a failing, it‚Äôs in low end bass. anyone expecting too much of that from a 3.5‚Äù mid/bass, may be somewhat optimistic...i matched these units with an existing sub unit and the overall sound quality is outstanding for the price. the 3.5s bottom out at 80hz. bear that in mind. on their own they are superior to many desktop speakers, but you need a sub if you want a full ‚Äòsound stage‚Äô...there was some buzzing on install. the supplied cables are - adequate. i thought i might have to invest in some better (shielded) ones. however, judicious positioning of the power and input cables solved the problem...would i recommend these? yes. i don‚Äôt know what comes near them at their price.

Title: really good for the price
Content: firstly i'll point out i get absolutely no mains hum from these whatsoever but studio monitors are sensitive to it. i had massive problems with my adams caused by a duff mains adaptor. it'll usually be either from the leads or other devices plugged into same mains block. if possible give these they're own socket. lamps can be trouble if in same socket. tv seems fine in same block. upgrading interconnect cables also helps a lot. mine are 50 quid and that's overkill but 20 or 30 should do. the supplied ones are really low end sub 5 pound cables and don't do the speakers justice. got these as an upgrade from the pioneer dm40s. i have a set of adam audio studio monitors upstairs and everytime i listened in my lounge i found the sound good but underwhelming. have these connected up to the tv and use for tv and music. they are much more immersive and higher clarity than the pioneers. soundstage comes out much further. like having separate bass and treble controls too to tweak the sound. music videos come to life. they're not as good as the adams but they are an extra 100 and bigger too and more professional. for 160 i paid for these they are great. treble is clear, sound is lively and fun. bass is good for the size of the speaker. good in my relatively small lounge. rear ported so keep away from walls or cover the ports if that's not possible .

Title: lightweight build quality
Content: bought from amazon warehouse as none in stock at the time, i was disappointed to find no instructions or software as advertised . more alarming was the lightweight build quality that has a hollow ring to it when you tap the cabinet. i was not expecting great things, but i was wrong (mostly).there is plenty of power for nearfield monitoring and it digs deep keeping the notes tuneful and tight, no flabbiness at all. i was impressed! if only it didn't look and feel like a cheap imitation of the real thing it would have got 5 stars. i also would like the power light to go out or at least blink when it enters standby.

Title: unsure about sound quality
Content: i have these monitors (3.5") mounted on a couple stands, plugged into a steinberg ur22 via trs...the only other pair of monitors i've owned are the m-audio av30. i seem to recall them having much more crisp sound quality than these, so i'm a little disappointed..the sound comes across as a little muddy and heavy on the low-frequencies, without having the depth of sound of a larger box...the stitching/joining around the centre part of my right speaker also looks pretty rough. will upload a picture and ask for feedback from the seller when i can.

Title: packs a punch
Content: so after doing lots of research and countless videos on budget monitor speakers it was a choice between these and a few other speakers within the same price range. i decided to purchase these speakers and i must say im very impressed! i wanted some speakers for music production and djing but was a little apprehensive as i heard the bass on these are not as deep as the others and i am very much a person who loves my bass. these speakers pack a punch and carry a good bass, obviously you want get a deep ground rumbling bass but it does have enough bass to hear and feel and great clarity which is a must when producing music. they are also surprisingly loud, louder than i expected. the bass does get a bit distorted when cranked right up which is to be expected. the sound easily fills the room and is ideal if your a bedroom producer/dj or to just play songs on.

Title: great but works best with an equaliser...
Content: out of the box, the speakers are pretty bass heavy and have a muffled low/mid sound. it left dialogue and footsteps feeling very muted but explosions and any music very dominant. the knobs on the back to adjust the treble and bass only do so much (not a lot)...however as i use them with a pc, applying an equaliser like dolby atoms, you can balance out the highs, mids and lows to get the best out of these speakers...once adjusted the speakers have the ability to produce clear highs and lows, albeit the lows can still be heard more...overall 4/5 for price, build quality and noise quality.
Clean Content: box, speakers pretty bass heavy muffled low/mid sound. left dialogue footsteps feeling muted explosions music dominant. knobs back adjust treble bass much (not lot)...however use pc, applying equaliser like dolby atoms, balance highs, mids lows get best speakers...once adjusted speakers ability produce clear highs lows, albeit lows still heard more...overall 4/5 price, build quality noise quality.

Title: unusable due to missing cables and not being able to download the drivers
Content: bought these from amazon for a christmas present for my son. however, on christmas day he found the cables were missing. contacted amazon who offered a small discount so i could then purchase the missing cables which i bought from amazon. these arrived today and he was able to set the speakers up to then find that he couldn't download the necessary drivers and software because when he tried to register the product they had previously been registered to someone else making them not fit for purpose. amazon have offered a refund however the price has increased from the price i paid for them so in order to replace them i will have to shell out more money on top of the additional amount i've spent on cables which we no longer need. i've always been happy with purchases and service i've received from amazon but this christmas i have encountered several problem with item purchased. this was the biggest disappointment of them all and has caused one headache after another trying to resolve it with several different chat assistants.

Title: it‚Äôs what a small home studio requires
Content: as an edm artist i like my tracks to have plenty of low end, and 3-7‚Äù monitor speakers fail to provide that deep sub bass reproduction, so a dedicated sub will always be needed to monitor them low frequencies, headphones get a part of the way there, but you will still miss valuable frequencies as true sub bass is felt instead of heard..i‚Äôm very impressed with the impact of such a small unit, it drives them body blows of sub bass straight to your gut, and really fills that gap in my frequencies, it‚Äôs speeded my workflow up tremendously as i now need not play my mixes in the car before uploading them, or when i do play then in the car they are much closer to being final..it‚Äôs a very well isolated unit also, having the rubber legs really helps avoid transference to the surface it stands on, and the fully frontal facing driver and reflex port allows me to be more directional with the sound, not that it matters too much because this thin fills the entire room and leaks in to the rest of the house.

Title: slight modification made all the difference.
Content: since owning the sub i was always aware of a slight hum from the transformer. i tried a power conditioner that didn't make any difference. it will void the warranty as i did but i removed the amp from the back and found that the hum was coming from the transformer reveberating through the body of the sub. i ordered some m4 10mm x 15mm rubber mounts from amazon and mounted the transformer with them. i added a silicone tubing to hang under the transformer for added support. i thought i had done something wrong because when i turned it on i thought it wasn't working because it was silent. am very happy with it now. sounds great when you want it to, and doesn't make a sound when you don't want it to. these are the mounts i used..... https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/b07qv8vmxh/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o03_s00?ie=utf8&psc=1
Clean Content: since owning sub always aware slight hum transformer. tried power conditioner didn't make difference. void warranty removed amp back found hum coming transformer reveberating body sub. ordered m4 10mm x 15mm rubber mounts amazon mounted transformer them. added silicone tubing hang transformer added support. thought done something wrong turned thought wasn't working silent. happy now. sounds great want to, doesn't make sound want to. mounts used..... https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/b07qv8vmxh/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o03_s00?ie=utf8&psc=1

Title: just brilliant audio.
Content: i already own a pair of harbeth dmp1 and dpm1 mini. bought these for the new summerhouse, being active and bluetooth was essential, being used mainly as projector soeaker and android studio...whilst not up to the harbeth, i wasn't expecting them to be, but they are way better than expected. details follow...stereo separation is perfect almost up to harbeth standard...clarity-unbelievably good, every instrument can be heard...bass- yes in spades, it's clear and unmuffled. won't need to turn this up on the controls it's perfect at standard. don't believe anyone who says it's lacking...treble-turned this up a tage but i have tinitus, even at standard it's excellent. most won't need to touch it but for me it's nice to have the adjustment...power-yes more than enough...listening to music it is like being in the studio where it was mixed. working in a number of studios i know what i'm talking about...reading reviews of this and another brand i was a bit concerned. didn't need to be though. everything i'd hoped for and more...value for money, without doubt, sound quality is way above the price paid. i'd recommend these to anyone, for a number of reasons...home studio, yes perfect. tv and youtube etc again yes, better than surround sound which is artificial, the natural clarity separation and bass is better. subwoofer will not be needed...if i could have given 10 stars i would.
Clean Content: already pair harbeth dmp1 dpm1 mini. bought new summerhouse, active bluetooth essential, used mainly projector soeaker android studio...whilst not harbeth, wasn't expecting be, way better expected. details follow...stereo separation perfect almost harbeth standard...clarity-unbelievably good, every instrument heard...bass- yes spades, clear unmuffled. won't need turn controls perfect standard. believe anyone says lacking...treble-turned tage tinitus, even standard excellent. won't need touch nice adjustment...power-yes enough...listening music like studio mixed. working number studios know i'm talking about...reading reviews another brand bit concerned. didn't need though. everything i'd hoped more...value money, without doubt, sound quality way price paid. i'd recommend anyone, number reasons...home studio, yes perfect. tv youtube etc yes, better surround sound artificial, natural clarity separation bass better. subwoofer not needed...if given 10 stars would.

Title: perfect speakers, perfectly priced!
Content: im really pleased with these speakers, so much that i am frustrated i pondered for a long time before purchasing...honestly, if you're after some active bookshelf speakers and your budget isnt the largest, then get these, dont hesitate!!! these are as good as or better than lots of the higher priced ones out there, that are passive and require an amp which can add up costs...these look great, have a good weight to them and i think they're flawless hooked up to my turntable...10/10

Title: good desktop speakers, but not true monitors
Content: some of the reviews here suggest that presonus have a quality control issue with the eris 3.5. no such problems with mine, i'm happy to report. no hum, imperceptible hiss even with the volume turned right up, and both channels are equally loud...connected by unbalanced rca cables to my focusrite scarlett 2i4, the sound is clear with as much bass as you'd expect from such small woofers and plenty of treble. the midrange is good with reasonable amounts of detail. when used as desk-mounted near-field speakers, volume levels are very adequate...the eq controls on the back of the left-hand (master) speaker are of limited use. i found little point in adjusting the bass control as turning it up just made the sound confused and flabby without actually making it go any deeper. if you want lots of deep bass from small speakers then adding a subwoofer is the only way to go. however, the rather splashy treble does benefit from being turned down a bit as these speakers are plenty bright...as for whether they are "monitors"; no, not really. they are decent-sounding desktop speakers at a fair price that are a huge improvement on cheap plastic ones, but they're too bright for reliable mixing and mastering, and would tend to create a a mix that would sound dull on other, more balanced speakers, and would also be quite hopeless for setting bass levels correctly...one last positive comment - there's no automatic turn-off after an inactive period as one sees with many powered speakers, so there's less risk of missing an alert because your speakers have decided to go into power-saving mode.

Title: exceeded expectations
Content: i'm glad i didn't take notice of reviews that the sound quality is inferior and affected by humming. these are solid-state speakers (and come as a pair, not one as one bizarre review stated) and sound fantastic...i heard instruments in garage band recordings i thought were a lot lower in the mix. but unless you have electrical grounding or wiring issues, you'll experience no humming and will find these to be exceptional value for money.

Title: compact yet impressive
Content: i had been looking at these for awhile before i took the plunge - and i'm very glad i bought them!..for many years i had used the bose companion set of speakers with a small subwoofer connected to my pc. they were a bit overpriced but sounded great...when the control unit packed up on them i was struggling to find a worthy replacement. like another reviewer, i tried the creative gigaworks t40 series ii - they were awful! not a very clear sound at all and no matter how i adjusted thyem they were swamped with a muddy mid sound. although i'm not a music producer i do like to be able to hear my music clearly and these little units do the trick very well indeed...quick and easy to unpack and install, the pads to isolate them from whatever you stand them on are a very nice addition. i connected them to my computer and immediately noticed what i'd been missing...i will probably use the tuning controls on the back to get them exactly how i want them but even without doing that, the audio quality and soudstage are really very good. i'd say money well spent on these units...i listen to a very wide range of music styles and genres, so far they all sound great.

Title: surprisingly good for audio
Content: i bought these in a rush as the power socket broke on my trusty (and very old) roland ma-10s broke. in an ideal world i would have gone for the krk ones to replace but i just don't have that kind of scratch right now and i really couldn't wait, i had stuff i needed to do and didn't want to waste even a single day. these arrived the next day which was really impressive...at first when they arrived i was disappointed. they looked really cheap and plasticky and were nowhere near as solid as the (mdf) rolands. i almost thought about sending them back tbh, they just didn't look like they were up to the job. i saw how they are referred to as 'multimedia monitors' and not 'studio monitors' on the box and got that sinking feeling that i'd wasted my money......i decided to plug them in and listen to them. at first they didn't sound that pleasant. its a very 'active' sound, very blown up and unnatural. but i compared it to my rolands and a/b'd them for a while and conditioned my ears to the new sound and then started to realise how bad the rolands actually were. they were so fizzy and boomy in comparison, the mids seemed scooped too, they were masking all kinds of problems. on these i could straight away notice some quite major flaws in the low and high ends of the track i was working on which wasn't apparent before. people are saying they are no good for below 80hz (which figures with such small cones) but tbh i've been quite impressed with the bass response so far. i would say 80-120hz is actually very clear. for the sub bass i would use headphones anyway, seriously these seem fine for audio use...i have a full size pair of roland ds-7s which cost a few hundred quid which i absolutely love and they don't compare to those at all. i actually like listening to music on those where as these are just a tool. these will be my convenient, low volume, day to day monitors...but yeah i'm very happy with these. if you were a beginner these would be perfect as your main monitors for a

Title: wow are the cases resonant
Content: i've had my pair of e3.5's for about 3 hours as of writing this review. they sound pretty good now...but to my ears, they didn't before tinkering.....the cases are 1/4" mdf, sound very resonant when knocked, and could be felt to move due to bass notes. this colours the sound quite a bit with a sort of boxy boomy nonsense going in the upper bass/lower male voice region...to cure them, opened them up and added sound-deadening mat to the walls as well as a few small cross braces. fun opening the right-hand speaker is it's glued together. so carefully cut the back off using the table saw...you can probably accomplish most of this by turning them on their sides and putting a pile of books on them to stops the sides from vibrating...the port still seems set slightly high. presumably to get a flat (or slight rise in bass response as that sells). i prefer a slight roll-off, so printing short flared extensions for the ports for the inside of the cabinet. in essence, i'm after the response somewhere between blocked ports and the as purchased response. so lengthening it a bit will lower the resonance and also slightly scupper the coupling...the amp within them is a tda 7265 to save anyone screwdriver effort to get there - also not very "studio"...in conclusion, they're not studio quality monitors at all. can't even be bothered to get out the test gear for them. but fun as a sunday project to buy dinky speakers and get them working a little better was pleasing. they work well with my headphones, which automatically switch over to the speakers when turned off. and now the case resonances are out the way of human voices will be great for conference calls and a bit of spotify while working...giving 3/5 as not good enough to be monitors, being that they colour the sound too much in stock form. but not 0, as were fun to play with and are now fixed. i didn't need monitors. if i did, then would purchase genelec whose factory i'll be touring soon (and will probably purchase some for by

Title: .....for the money they are amazing. i'll try that again, 'they are amazing'.
Content: have been trying to get decent pc speakers for ages, have managed to get decent headphones (akg k612 pro), but never decent speakers. the last set i "upgraded" to were creative gigaworks t40 series ii (2.0), and they were "ok", and not cheap. i guess i should have dropped the idea of "pc speakers" long ago...so, after putting up with the "ok" creative labs effort (don't get me started on the eu power saving garbage), and getting into the habit of perma-wearing headphones. i finally decided to check out 'studio monitors' and was about to 'reluctantly' (have you seen the price) pull the trigger on a pair of yamaha hs5's when i saw a review of those compared to the presonus e3.5...well at circa a 25% of the price of the yamaha's, i didn't take much convincing. the presonus arrived about 2 hours ago and they will not be going back. i just can't believe that they were less than the price of the creative labs 'efforts' i bought last year...mostly i listen to classical and binge watch streaming services, which seems to really suit these type of monitors, much like the reference headphones i mentioned earlier...i'm no sound guru, but to me they sound 'perfect'. as for the looks, yes they are plain matt black, well i want to hear them not see them, and no rgb, shame ;-)..as for accessories, they come with a power lead (no separate power brick, thankfully) and cables (mini jack to mini jack, mini jack to left/right phono, and some speaker wire) that will get most people up and running, also some acoustic pads to stick to the base or side...mine are on their side under the screen on my desk, and..well if you have any doubts after reading other reviews or watching youtube reviews, don't. unless your happy to pull the trigger on those yamaha hs5's i'd look no further than here...i'll certainly be recommending these to friends and colleagues...p.s. ...and they don't go to sleep at the drop of a hat like the creative speakers do, so no more missing reminders.

Title: not a studio monitor or anywhere close, but . . .
Content: these are pretty good speakers for the money. but they are not in anyway shape or form "studio monitors" - that is just preposterous marketing hype and presonus should be thoroughly ashamed of themselves, not least because they know perfectly well how to make studio grade gear. these are not that...my concern is for people thinking they can realistically spend less than a hundred quid and get the kind of flat uncoloured sound a real studio monitor would deliver, but to get that, you're realistically talking about hundreds of pounds per speaker for a decent home studio set up and thousands of pounds per speaker for a professional studio set up. and that's without considering room acoustic treatment etc. just a reality check. all that said, these are decent speakers - not monitors - speakers. enjoy them for what they are, not what they're pretending to be. and if you're trying to mix on them, just a/b with headphones, car stereo, earbuds etc, so you learn them.
Clean Content: pretty good speakers money. not anyway shape form "studio monitors" - preposterous marketing hype presonus thoroughly ashamed themselves, not least know perfectly well make studio grade gear. not that...my concern people thinking realistically spend less hundred quid get kind flat uncoloured sound real studio monitor deliver, get that, realistically talking hundreds pounds per speaker decent home studio set thousands pounds per speaker professional studio set up. that's without considering room acoustic treatment etc. reality check. said, decent speakers - not monitors - speakers. enjoy are, not they're pretending be. trying mix them, a/b headphones, car stereo, earbuds etc, learn them.

Title: these are great monitors.
Content: i love the eris 3.5‚Äôs, i already own the eris e5‚Äôs and wanted monitors that would compliment them, i also added the presonus sub 8 subwoofer and routed them all through my presonus monitor station v2. i am thrilled at the clarity and depth this set up gives me. we record & mix vocal tracks and needed to hear the various frequencies clearly, this has been achieved. i highly recommend this product...i am an independant writer producer who mainly worked in large rooms, my home set up was for composition and ideas, since the pandemic we decided to upgrade our room with a new soundcraft digital desk, new imac and an 88 key nektar lx88 controller keyboard, the next phase was monitors. the eris 3.5‚Äôs completed our upgrade and we are now very happy, the 3.5‚Äôs are affordable and well made with a fantastic flat response, perfect for creators of any level and a great starting point for home studio monitoring.

Title: great sound and value. don‚Äôt worry about hiss or hum.
Content: i was a bit worried about purchasing these as there are quite a few reviews complaining about mains hum and hiss. i can report that you can hear a hiss only if you put your ear up to the speaker, that you will get with all active speakers, you get a mild buzzing sound from the left one when you are connected with bluetooth. these are both very minor and nothing to worry about (i am very fussy). the majority of bad reviews i think are relating to the older version of these. presonus seem to have addressed the problem quite well with this newer version..the most important thing is the sound and i think that these sound fantastic for the money. i have been a so called audiophile for the last 45 years and i have spent way more money than this on passive speakers that don‚Äôt sound as good..regarding the sound, i am using these for listening to music not for mixing or production. these are near field monitors which means that you sit only a few feet away from them to get the best sound, they will fill most rooms not a problem but the best sound is found when you sit close to them..because these are designed to be uses in a studio the sound is not emphasised at all, you get a pretty flat frequency response. with these speakers poor recordings sound poor and great recordings sound great. all in all i am really happy with these.

Title: bass response is nonexistent
Content: i like these speakers for mixing- i have a small setup (laptop, keyboard controller and the speakers). they give you a really good idea of balancing levels but- it's really difficult to balance bass instruments as there is virtually no bass response. i have to switch to headphones to do that. trying to eq a bass instrument is very difficult on these speakers. if they had a better bass response then i would give 10/10 for this product. the mid, treble and stereo image are very accurate though. i'm still glad i got these speakers though.

Content: i was surprised by the quality of sounds from such compact units. i have bought similar units in the past & been slightly disappointed by both the build & sound quality, but not in this case. the presonus units feel solidly built & the quality of sound from such compact units is excellent. i dabble in music making so being able to hear subtle differences in timbre from different instruments is important & these speakers deliver. i like the option of the headphone jack on the front for those occasions when needed. the improvement in sounds for my gaming has also been very welcome. the added bonus of a decent daw was a pleasant surprise. recommended.

Title: 25 mins and ka-bloey!! replacements working but reliability concerns remain.
Content: got this item today. sounded good for all of 25 mins when connected via a line in playing music. then buzz, crackle, flash and dead. my assumption is the amp in the left unit has shorted. amazon have been really good and i've risked ordering a replacement. will see what that one is like but at the moment am not impressed..14/07/2021-i now have a working set of speakers (well they've been working 3 days!). sound quality is good. i have good full range hearing and, as such all my devices are set to flat equalisation - and these speakers are set the same. sound quality is great. no "boomy bass" that i'd read in other reviews and i've played a selection of music through them from opera to heavy rock to pop and rnb. i'll reset my rating to a 3 from 1 star - not based on the sound quality which is excellent and worthy of 5 stars - but just on my ongoing concerns on longevity and reliability. for reference i'm balancing in a 4m square room and haven't turned the speakers up above a quarter yet. both speakers are stood on acoustic pads to prevent sound bleed/vibration into the wooden desk on which they're stood.

Title: fine for desktop use
Content: bought these for desktop use for a home office where i wanted a some decent speakers for the endless zoom calls!. they are nice and clear, however i have to say they are a little boomy at the 120hz range, so voices can resonate at that annoying frequency. ive ended up turning the 'low' eq dial right down to counteract it. having said that they're nice bright, so speech is clear. music sounds ok, though you wouldnt really get these if that was your primary use for them. these are nice compact units, plenty of volume and easy to set up. i would have scored them higher if they had usb input but you cant have everything for eighty quid i guess.

Title: accurate on the highs not so on the bass
Content: these are pretty good at this price...they are particularly accurate and detailed in the high frequencies with good stereo definition. the bass is a different matter, however, revealing a very distinctive frequency bump at 150hz...so it'll sound artificially 'boomy' without the subs (obviously not much sub-100hz given the small size of the speakers). rolling off the bass on the controls helps a little bit but the 150hz peak remains...used for mixing, i think these are good for a three-four hour session at low volume but there is some ear fatigue (for me) any longer than that, especially at higher volumes.
Clean Content: pretty good price...they particularly accurate detailed high frequencies good stereo definition. bass different matter, however, revealing distinctive frequency bump 150hz...so it'll sound artificially 'boomy' without subs (obviously not much sub-100hz given small size speakers). rolling bass controls helps little bit 150hz peak remains...used mixing, think good three-four hour session low volume ear fatigue (for me) longer that, especially higher volumes.

Title: outstanding for the price.
Content: presonus really show off why they are the last word in professional audio with these speakers...the audio from these speakers is sharp and accurate, all the way down the the advertised 30hz cutoff. yet despite this they still provide a comfortable listening experience when being used for non professional tasks...the speakers are able to push an impressive volume for there small size, however they are still monitors, don't expect them to fill a large room with sound. the amplifier's are very quiet with no audible hiss or hum from the speakers even in a silent room (also with the inputs disconnected)..the one gripe i have with these speakers is they have a bright blue power led on the front above the volume knob. this is unfortunate as it is very annoying in a darkened room, however is easily remedied with a small square of black electrical tape...for this price i would recommend these to anyone, with professional monitors this cheap most computer speaker manufacturers (logitech) should probably just give up.

Title: great little speakers
Content: i've had these about 3 weeks and pleased with then. i bought them to use with my laptop running cubase, and for gaming and for the family to use. i use them wired when using cubase as the audio comes out via a steinberg ur242 usb audio interface and so use phono leads to take the audio from the ur242. when gaming i use them via bluetooth and the family have paired their phones so they can play their tunes. the speakers were playing within 2 minutes of unboxing, no issues at all. it's handy having the volume on the front and also handy having headphones out on the front as it means i can monitor there when recording if someone else is using the headphone out from the ur242 to records vocals. the sound is punchy and very clear up to quite loud volumes. play them at full volume and you might get a little distortion from the bass but hey, they're tiny! the eq can be tweaked (bass and treble) which is handy or just leave them at 0 if you want a more accurate sound when recording. i'm really glad a spent just a few quid more to get the bluetooth version and if you're going to be sharing these with the rest of the household like i am then go for that option. if you have a dedicated space for home recording (lucky you!) then the wired version would be fine.

Title: uncontrolled bass
Content: i don‚Äôt normally review anything but thought it would help others. i used to work in the hi fi industry running a hi fi shop for many years and have a very nice setup in my lounge, so know a thing or two about audio..having looked online at many reviews you often purchase on the many recommendations, this is never a good idea but perhaps sometimes necessary, so i purchased the presonus eris e3.5 and set them up and ran them in..i was presented with a sound that is so uncontrolled in the low frequency, so much so that i could not live with them, this is in part to do with the speaker boxes and lack of rigidity...the bass is so bad that it just colours everything, you could improve things by bringing them away from walls and use a good pair of speakers stands that are mass loaded but then most pc setups are on a desk and are against a wall. of course, i know sound is subjective and some will love that kind of bass but i am pretty sure i could make a better pair from a cornflake box, it‚Äôs also worth saying that the presonus eris e3.5 are priced as a budget pair of pc speakers and cost very little and i understand that there are also limiting factors like the pc sound card, but unfortunately, i can‚Äôt recommend them due to their boomy uncontrolled bass.

Title: great budget speakers
Content: i already own the e4.5s and wanted to downsize to get more space on my desk. my thoughts purchasing the e3.5bt was that they'll have a similar, if not the same sound profile as the e4.5s. how wrong i was...the sound on the e3.5bt is thinner, lacking significantly in the mid-range. the highs are excellent due to the 1 inch tweeter found in both versions. the lows are excellent as well, but not as punchy as the e4.5s...the build quality of both speakers is phenomenal for the price. don't think you can get a better deal for kevlar woven speakers at this price point...i read a lot of comments about ac (mains) hum. my e3.5bt unit did exhibit ac humming at high volume (~>70%). however, its not audible at lower volumes which is absolutely great. you can set the volume at a lower level on the speakers and crank up the volume at the source (pc, phone, tablet etc). i do also have to mention that there's a white background noise, barely audible for it to be a worrying factor...bluetooth 5.0 is a great addition as well. pairs and connects with no issues. however it doesn't support codecs such as aptx-hd or ldac. only got sbc to work on my android phone...in conclusion, the e3.5bt is great if you're upgrading from a basic setup. i think you'll absolutely enjoy these speakers. however i do believe the e4.5s sound better. better lows and mids...too bad my plan didn't work. i'm keeping my e4.5s and returning the e3.5bt. i don't think i can give up the sound quality for a few square cm of desk space. i'm going to try the audioengine a2+ next.

Title: impressive - once setup properly but bluetooth could be better
Content: when i first got these speakers, i really didn't like them..1. the bass was boomy making the low and mid all a bit 'muddy'. checking on the presonus faqs it is recommended to keep the speakers away from the walls by 4 feet (1.5ft mentioned elsewhere) because of the rear port, so i pulled them forward and the boomy muddyness had gone, delivering a balanced sound with detail and punch. i was thinking of adding a subwoofer but i'm not going to bother - i like the sound as is (obviously these speakers won't shake the room)..2. there is a background hiss when using bluetooth, higher than when using the rca inputs. presonus helped by suggesting turning the source (e.g. your phone) to maximum volume and turning down the volume on the speakers. the hiss is now low enough not to be noticeable in normal use..3. the bluetooth mostly doesn't reconnect to previously paired devices. i have to press the pair button every time i turn the speakers on.4. the volume isn't the highest. these are advertised ' it may be small but the e3.5 is loud, as well as clear' but don't expect anything like your home hifi with 50w amp. i don't turn my home hifi up much at all (not after annoying the neighbors) but these need turning up much more. but they are near field monitors not dj speakers...on balance, i love these speakers. great detailed balanced sound. ideal for streaming 6 music at my desk while working from home without disturbing the rest of the house. bluetooth could be better but good enough for my use, no way good enough for music production (but then you wouldn't be using bluetooth anyway)...ps no problems with mains hum as some report. this is probably because i've not wired them to another piece of mains equipment which creates ground loops.

Title: poor power supply
Content: i've had two pairs of these speakers, the first pair failed to turn on after their third day of use...i returned that pair with no trouble and opted for a replacement - i'll always give a second chance...the second pair had an audible hum - very unlikely to be a ground loop, it was on the same outlet as the source and i tried others - it wasn't a loud hum and may be something that others could ignore but once i noticed it, its all i could hear...i suspect that the issues that i had with both sets were related to the internal power supply. ignoring this issue, the speakers offer a good sound at a good price.

Title: accurate, really good (but not the best) bass
Content: disclaimer: i'm not an audiophile, just a casual...really good speakers, i use it in a home gym 24ft √ó 12ft. they've got enough volume to fill the gym while maintaining quality...the vocals and instruments like that of string feel really accurate. the bass is real punchy, although not quite as much as i'd want it (i listen to a lot of bassy grime & dubstep). it definitely feels the best around for the price and type (being bookshelves). for now they're enough to pump me up during workout. if i need more bass i'd upgrade with a sub...before this i had the 5 in 1 logitech, returned those for these and haven't looked back. each one of these bookshelves far outperforms each of the logitech speakers.

Title: excellent sound, great value for money.
Content: i originally bought some m-audio v32‚Äôs for my small home set up, they were awful, way too bass heavy, muddy sound and no adjustments. the presonus sound so much better. they feel very solidly built and have a crisp sound with plenty of power for a small set up, they get quite loud without much of a drop in sound quality when turned up. they also have basic equaliser knobs on the back but i‚Äôve never needed to change them from the central position. i‚Äôve started using them for general audio consumption over my bigger system for day to day listening because they sound so nice. definitely recommend for the price.

Title: excellent all-rounders...
Content: the eris e4.5's really are excellent all-rounders. in my case, they're hooked up to a computer with an ess 9038-based dac and mostly used for gaming and general media consumption...lossless audio formats like .flac and even high-quality .mp3's sound absolutely spot on! even with the volume cranked up, highs are crisp and clear, and the mid-range is natural-sounding with lovely definition. the low-ends and bass are more punchy than deep, which is no surprise for bookshelf-sized monitors, but that's not a bad thing. highs, mids and lows are clean and clearly distinguishable with minimal overlapping or bleeding. in any case, a dedicated sub woofer could always be added for those who require more of a boomy or rumbly bass sound to their set-up...out of the box i found that the highs were a bit too prominent for my taste, but was easily rectifiable using the tone control located on the rear of the left speaker. in any case, i tend to run different audio profiles (eq settings) from the source (a computer) depending on what i'm doing or listening to...having had the eris e4.5's sat on my desk for ~ 2 months now, i would happily recommend them to anyone looking for affordable, high-quality speakers for their set-up.
Clean Content: eris e4.5's really excellent all-rounders. case, they're hooked computer ess 9038-based dac mostly used gaming general media consumption...lossless audio formats like .flac even high-quality .mp3's sound absolutely spot on! even volume cranked up, highs crisp clear, mid-range natural-sounding lovely definition. low-ends bass punchy deep, no surprise bookshelf-sized monitors, that's not bad thing. highs, mids lows clean clearly distinguishable minimal overlapping bleeding. case, dedicated sub woofer always added require boomy rumbly bass sound set-up...out box found highs bit prominent taste, easily rectifiable using tone control located rear left speaker. case, tend run different audio profiles (eq settings) source (a computer) depending i'm listening to...having eris e4.5's sat desk ~ 2 months now, happily recommend anyone looking affordable, high-quality speakers set-up.

Title: excellent. run them on a separate electrical socket for zero mains hum issues.
Content: i bought these to replace 3‚Äù m-audio speakers that lasted 10 years. these 4.5 speakers sound much better - perfect for putting together a rough mix, and general every day listening. i have a double electric socket near my desk. my pc, monitors , usb stuff etc run on a single extension cord into one socket. these speakers run into the other socket. there is absolutely no mains hum coming from the speakers. i‚Äôm running audio from the pc headphone out into the speakers via the 3.5mm aux in at the front of the left hand speaker unit...if the speakers are plugged into the extension cord with everything else there is mains hum from the speakers...i hope this info helps someone.
Clean Content: bought replace 3‚Äù m-audio speakers lasted 10 years. 4.5 speakers sound much better - perfect putting together rough mix, general every day listening. double electric socket near desk. pc, monitors , usb stuff etc run single extension cord one socket. speakers run socket. absolutely no mains hum coming speakers. i‚Äôm running audio pc headphone speakers via 3.5mm aux front left hand speaker unit...if speakers plugged extension cord everything else mains hum speakers...i hope info helps someone.

Title: wish i'd bought more mackie cr3's instead.
Content: i really can't understand all the good reviews. as studio ''flat response'' monitors, these suck. as cheap hi-fi speakers, these suck....listening to techno through these and the bass distorts wildly. listening to metal and the bass and high end all gets squished into the mid somehow. and listening to punk through these and the music almost vanishes completely and leaves just the vocals, like they are some kind of reverse karaoke machine!...then using the headphone socket at low volumes and all i get is a loud hum, but when i turned these and my daw up until it was totally in the red i could still only just hear it....but when i plugged these in to the headphone socket of my tv and watched ''dune'' for the millionth time it sounded better than ever. what's with that?! are these calibrated for speech or cinema rather than music?...i have other presonus products, so i know that they are capable great things..but these speakers are not among them.
