Title: good value for money
Content: i don't have experience with studio monitors so i'd done a lot of research and listened to many comparisons before deciding on this pair of speakers. after a couple of months of using them i can say i'm happy with the purchase. the sound is clear and the response quite flat across the spectrum (judging how different commercial recordings sound - again, i've no comparison to other monitors)...the speakers have a low level hiss, even when the volume knob is turned all the way down (in fact it doesn't seem to have anything to do with the volume). but i need to stick my ear next to the monitor to hear it. at normal listening distance of about 1 metre i don't hear anything, so for me it's not a problem.

Title: great sound, value and connectivity
Content: i tried many small monitor speaker these were easily the best and the cheapest. i believe these are the smallest monitor speakers available just right for a desktop home studio..i liked the option of balanced trs connectors (perfect for connecting to audio interface m-audio air 192|14. also a bonus to have self- contained power supply so just plug in the figure-of-eight mains cable, no adapter..the sound is full and clear and there are two adjustments for high and low eq..volume control, power switch, aux in and headphone jack all the front for easy access..exceptional value for money i paid ¬£83 for the pair. one of those rare products that is just perfect.

Title: just what i wanted
Content: having grown up with bbc monitor speakers (spendor bc1 and rogers ls3/5a) before forced downsizing, i wanted a pair of small self-powered monitor speakers for tv, blu-ray and cd. good speech quality was essential. my audio router includes level control, so the volume on the master speaker can be set and left. top and bass +/- 6db is a bonus on the rear, with a tactile notch at 0. no noticeable noise from the amp..one surprise was a mains lead with european plug, but supplier had added a uk 13a mains lead.

Title: true sound
Content: did my research on these, as all i needed were computer speakers used both for watching films/shows and listening to music. so wanted something true, without enhanced bass and all that other nonsense which you can apply via an equaliser; also wanted small and lightish. they're perfect, plenty loud with a nice crisp clear sound from their 1" tweeters, and there's that boom when things go bang on screen + i can hear dialogue clear. tested on abbey road & miss anthropocene, 2 very crisp produced albums separated by 50 years, and loved the results. was going to purchase up spec leads and speaker wire, but may not need to, as i'm not sure it will improve the sound. anyone who says they're not bossy enough has obviously grown up on beats and other bass heavy rubbish; in fact, i've turned the bass down a notch, but it's great neutral.
Clean Content: research these, needed computer speakers used watching films/shows listening music. wanted something true, without enhanced bass nonsense apply via equaliser; also wanted small lightish. they're perfect, plenty loud nice crisp clear sound 1" tweeters, there's boom things go bang screen + hear dialogue clear. tested abbey road & miss anthropocene, 2 crisp produced albums separated 50 years, loved results. going purchase spec leads speaker wire, may not need to, i'm not sure improve sound. anyone says they're not bossy enough obviously grown beats bass heavy rubbish; fact, i've turned bass notch, great neutral.

Title: impressive speakers for the price
Content: purchased as desktop speakers for use with computer (to replace maudio av40, which had failed after a number of years use). sound quality is subjective - various online / youtube reviews are generally very favourable - in my opinion sound quality (especially base) is very pleasing considering the size of the speakers and an improvement on the av40 (read the reviews for much more detailed comments on sound quality and comparisons). extra controls provide the opportunity to fine tune the sound. power / sound volume is more than adequate for my use in a smallish room. the controls / connections on the front are very convenient for my use. i also like the design aesthetic: very understated with no bold logo, distracting colours, lights etc.

Title: not powerfull but beautiful, clear sound
Content: i've been using these monitors to listen to music and i'm quite impressed by the sound quality of them. low frequencies and bass lines sound so clear, not coloured in my opinion. high frequencies are nice and crispy too through these. i don't normally fiddle with the controls at the front & back but instead set everything to 0, volume at 50% and use volume and equalizer controls from my laptop...i'm planning to use them for music production too, so they'll be part of my tiny home studio. there not powerful at all but i quite really enjoy the fact that i can turn down the volume a bit and still distinguish different frequencies clearly...i'm not giving them 5 stars as i cannot compare with others side-by-side at the moment.

Title: best speakers for hundred quid! don't miss out!
Content: these monitors are an absolute steal at this price, the original 3.5 are still selling out everywhere! nothing else at this price or below even comes close to the quality of sound and versatility of these amazing industrial looking boxes!..1 inch silk-dome tweeters are just something else on these beauties - the resolution, the extra wide sweetspot, the soundstage is all taken care of here. of course it's even covered with a small metal grate so fingers can't ruin them! bottom line, these tweeters are way better than anything i've ever experienced before... and i've had a lot of different speakers...not to forget about the 3.5 inch woven kevlar woofer finished off in dark blue/navy shade just adds such a touch of class. if you have natural light shining into your room/studio it just bounces off so nicely. won't improve the sound but definitely makes these eris monitors feel even more high quality. even down to the presonus badge, it really looks like it got some attention to detail. the ab amps are super quiet to turn on and operate, there's plenty of power at 25w per side for a medium sized studio room. i haven't even turned the volume knob past 35% at this point and i've had all the volume i needed so far!..i'm running mine from a decade old behringer uca222 audio interface with the ti pcm2902e dac chip via rca to trs cables - swapping l/r inputs to make sure the powered monitor is on the right due to preference. out of the box the active speaker is the left one, so remember that you can swap rca/trs if you wish!..conclusion - don't let the price fool you! these are a quality product, and i'm almost convicted with all the r&d that's gone into these boxes presonus are probably loosing money on each pair that they sell!!..the only con is the included speaker to speaker wire is a bit naff, but i picked up 3m of 99% ofc copper speaker wire from fleabay and couldn't be happier. it has cotton shielding and better transmission than stock wire. you can see it in the pictu

Title: ticks every box (if only they just looked a bit better) otherwise brilliant.
Content: i don‚Äôt do many reviews tbh.m, but these are something else..i purchased these and the famous pioneer dm-40 dj speakers to compare side by side..the pioneers apparently are more suited to edm music and the eris3.5 best as monitor speakers for clarity..looks - pioneers win.weight - pioneers win (does heavy mean better ? ).branding - pioneers win.size - pioneers bigger.value - presonus easily.clarity - presonus easily.functions - presonus - filters on rear for if the highs seem to high..bass - matchs if not exceeds the pioneers..there are not many reviews out their comparing the 2 but it‚Äôs safe to say, save ¬£50 and buy these. they are thumping value..balanced inputs and clearly produced by using r&d and not just thrown out their and a brand name thrown on them...the pioneer is 4‚Äù and the presonus is 3.5‚Äù but don‚Äôt worry about it..also the presonus has a better quality tweeter and bigger which makes a difference...overall full marks based on the cost v quality...be realistic with what to expect from something this size and price and be prepared to be amazed.

Title: presonus eris 3.5
Content: they say you get what you pay for. well ive certainly got my moneys worth. could of paid cheaper for these i know. however i just dont like sellers with bad feedback...anyway for late night listening to youtube netflix and spotify i needed some speakers with less bass. for the neighbours. so i got hold of a pair of creative t10s. they were ok but not an enjoyable listen. next was the ¬£129.99 edifier r1700bt. solidly built and well made. aweful sound though bass way to boomy for starters turn it down and it kills whatever youre listening to. so reading reviews like youre doing now i went looking again for a pair of speakers. it was my opinion id be wasting my time buying desktop speakers and decided i was going to buy monitors instead. so i was looking at so many brands, reading reviews here and on the internet. well i settled to buy these presonus eris 3.5. had them going for hours now. the soundstage is fantastic for such a small of speakers. the bass is sweet and the mids and highs clear. sure my tannoys are better sounding during the daytime hours and running from my arcam avr amp i can make my flat shake. however these for their money are well worth it and i am happy with my purchase. its a job well done

Title: brilliant speakers!
Content: these speakers are amazing for the price of money! i saw a lot of reviews saying there was a lot of mains hum however if your using trs input there is no hum unless you put your ear up to the speaker and even when doing that the noise is minimal. i have not tried rca so there could be more hum using that input. if you order in the uk it does come with a uk plug so no need to worry about buying an adapter:) these speakers for the price of money are amazing! they are great for mixing and perfect for a bedroom studio like mine! trs cables do not come in the box, so you will need to buy them, however you do get rca and an aux cable. overall these speakers are amazing for the price and are perfect for a bedroom studio!

Title: presonus eris are better than any small bookshelf speakers i've tried!
Content: picked these up last week for ¬£69 from another place and honestly can't believe the quality of these. all reviews are accurate, these are as minimalistic as they are light. they have a very clear presentation with sparkly treble and tightly controlled bass, but if you're sensitive to that not to worry because they also have high freq and low freq controls which means you can adjust it by up to 6db plus or minus on the rear of the main (l) speaker...for me personally it's different because i live in a flat, i actually turned down the bass by -1 to -2db and they sound great hooked up to my somewhat antique fiio e7 dac/amp with a wolfson 8740 audiophile level chip via 3.5mm to rca loops uk audio cables. sound signature and synergy from this combo is very musical, with great definition and sense of space. i also tried it with an xtrempro x1 ess sabre 9023 dac (available here on amazon for about ¬£34 shipped i think), and the sound synergy is pretty cold, rather forward and aggressive but still with decent soundstage. definitely more analytical, however this gets fatiguing for someone like me who listens to music for 2+ hours a day!..edit (14/05): i have upgraded the slightly thin l/r stock speaker wire that you get in the box to a much more reliable 250~ strand shielded cotton filled 99.9% ofc copper wire and i feel like there is a definite differnce but hey i only hooked it up today so it could be just placebo. i aint going back to the stock cable thats for sure!..i will also be getting a 3.5mm to 6.35mm lr interconnect cable (not balanced) so i can use the trs inputs and test to see if the audio quality improves or changes. will report back here soon! keep an eye out if you wanna know...---.conclusion:..these are hands down the best speakers i've ever had hooked up to my pc... and i have owned many in the past - trust, cambridge soundworks, 1byone, edifier e10bt, creative t20ii, creative t40ii (amazing but very much like dinosaurs, go for them if you like jurassic park

Title: perfect - please presonus, never change these
Content: in the eris e3.5, i've found the perfect speakers for my pc....but i would also say for a small room, these are the only speakers you'd need for any purpose...over the years i've tried various cambridge soundworks, logitechs, creatives etc. i used the gigaworks t40 series ii's for almost 10 years quite happily, they were good enough. until i got a fiio k3 amp/dac and didn't think they did it justice, so i started my search for upgraded monitors.....enter the tibo plus 1.1 (which cost more than these), but i found them to be too thin, harsh. they were more detailed than the t40s, but lacking any body to the sound and very shrill at even moderate volume ( i tried to get used to them, but i just couldnt).....so the search continued and i ordered these.... straight forward setup, all cables i required were provided..... 5 seconds in to some toto, i just grinned with delight, 2 hours later i was still going through my favourites playlist songs thinking... "i wonder how that song will sound on these?" ..... the answer was wonderful every time. rock, rap, blues, funk, hip-hop, jazz, classical, everything i tried just sounds so good. the treble is smooth yet detailed, but not piercing or fatiguing to my ears. the mids are there, and for such small speakers i can't believe the oomph these speaker pack. the bass is incredible for the size... even makes my desk vibrate (which the gigaworks t40s couldnt even do with two woofers). don't get me wrong... it's not sub bass, woofer style, but it's really clear and controlled. and i've learned that the numbers mean nothing... the tibo's frequency range started at 20hz, my creative's started at 50hz, and these e3.5's start at 80hz.... but they have the best, cleanest, punchiest, and deepest sounding bass out of those mentioned...nothing seems over emphasised to me, everything is 'there', all sounds and frequencies... i havent felt the need to adjust them, but there are bass/treble controls should you need them. i guess that's why thes

Title: brilliant
Content: absolutely brilliant !!.needed some new speakers for my home dj‚Äôing as had my previous ones for a number of years and felt the sound wasn‚Äôt as clear as it could be. read the reviews and couldn‚Äôt find a bad one, and for the price thought i‚Äôd order a pair. they are small and as i have wall brackets, i did have to cut down the extendable arm on my brackets to enable them the clamp the speaker but these were existing brackets and i was gonna make them fit either way. they are probably better to sit on a desk or something which has no back, as the powered speaker has a power lead, the 2 rca connections and the speaker cable link to the other speaker..once they were set up and turned on the decks, was amazed by the clarity and how loud they were for such a small speaker. my set up is in a room smaller than a bedroom and have the speakers quite close to me. remember these a near field monitor speakers so probably no good for a big room..but definitely recommend for a small room set up as they have more than enough power.

Title: small studio monitors that pack a great punch
Content: in terms of studio monitors, i only have experience with these 3.5" presonus monitors and the much larger, much more expensive yamaha hs8 monitors. the presonus monitors sound almost as impressive as the yamaha's. their rich treble and thick bass makes mixing and monitoring audio a pleasure. the whole frequency spectrum is cleanly audible and the range of options for input are a great bonus.

Title: monitor quality on a budget.
Content: i got these eris 4.5 powered speakers for my desktop mini-daw setup and general av use..i have genelecs for serious stuff but needed something better than my pc speakers for learning bass parts. paid gb¬£139.00 and amazon delivered next day..(i notice these are the newest version (mk 2?) with the jacks above each other and no range switches)..first impressions are highly favourable. bass is extended with real weight and slam, kick drum sounds true..mids are clean and the whole audio range is basically neutral and un-coloured..listening to the tracks i'm working on showed they matched the genelecs very well and mixes sounded similar. imaging and resolution are good enough to mix with, quite a surprise in a budget speaker...i highly recommend these for anyone looking for a budget monitor for music or podcasts, or for general av use.

Title: great value, but not blown away,
Content: these entry level studio monitors offer great value and a fairly decent sound. i was a little skeptical after some reviews had mentioned a static hum due to the power supply - thankfully mine have not had this issue...they also look great too and certainly feel like a premium product for the price paid. i had upgraded to these from some ¬£40 pc speakers and wasn't 'blown away' with the sound, but that being said, at the time of purchase, these were only around ¬£90 for the pair, which is considered to be at the low end for a professional set of studio monitors, so no real complaints there...the only issue for me so far, is that the main powered speaker is definitely louder than the slave speaker, and so i'm having to either adjust my output settings on my computer or change the speaker positioning to try and make up for this (both are not ideal solutions) - hence the reason for 4 stars, rather than 5...overall however, a decent purchase, which i'll use for 12 months or so before considering further upgrades.

Title: simple excellent for under ¬£100
Content: i needed a small pair of monitors to use in my flat, as i didnt want to get evicted buying anything too big..i usually use a pair of yamaha hs5s , and its been a smooth transition coming from those to the pre-sonus...pros:.1 - sound : nice and crisp with a 2-band eq to tailor the high and low frequencies. not boomy or flabby, and they seem to do well..2 - balanced inputs : no noise as i am running my yamaha ag06 into these guys from a laptop. there was no noise using unbalanced cables, but this is defintely prefeable..3 - super light-weight : really light and practical for small work-spaces or portable rigs..4 - price : superb for ¬£80-¬£90 best in class without a doubt...cons:.1 - bass response : i wouldnt use these for mixing lower than 80hz, as these things simply are not designed for that! the cones are too small, so look elsewhere if you want to mix low frequencies on it..2 - build quality : seems good so far, but only time will tell if i am back on here saying they broke after a few months...overall a fantastic pair of monitors for bed-room producers and audiophiles alike!

Title: presonus eris 4.5 great sound and price
Content: great value and no issues with hum, hiss or buzzing as some people report. the sound is flat, clean and well difined. i'm using with native instruments komplete kontrol and arturia keyboard recording equipment. very impressed. if sub bass is important for general listening you may wish to use a sub woofer. i'm using a elac sub 2030, complemented with bose and yamaha equipment. these prosonus monitors are a fantastic purchase and i cannot believe the quality for price. there are better but you'll struggle to find anything of this quality for this price. regarding the hum etc i believe people experiencing this is likely to be the power supply picking up off other power supply's and equipment, try repossessioning them and us decent cables. even at high volume in a silent room i'm getting no hum or interference sounds very impressed. i would definitely recommend these monitors to anyone interested in home recording on a budget. added benefit of good inputs and fine tuning.

Title: these are incredible for the price
Content: ok, mostly great reviews and i am on board with that. for those talking about a hum - i don't have that with mine, though i am using high quality cables, so if that's something you're on the fence about, go get yourself a set of balanced or unbalanced connectors and hopefully you won't have that issue..i was on the fence because of the price - as in i thought it was too low for anything to be decent. i was wrong..response wise from this, i am blown away. it is simply incredible. thanks to the acoustic tuning, i have had no issues getting these monitors sounding great and clear in my studio. i only got these today and have spent a bit of time mixing to get a feel of the frequency response and so far, they have been outstanding. i record both rock, edm and a weird hybrid of the two and so far, everything is clear. if you hear muddiness - it's your mix, and eq is your friend..all in all, outstanding value and i feel these will serve me well for years to come.

Title: unbeatable value
Content: i was looking for a set of monitors to mix down live recordings but didn't want to spend much. after reading good reviews, i bought these. i first tried them on my tv/media setup and the difference was immediate! a very nice, balanced sound but it was the clarity and definition which really impressed. later, hooking them up in the studio, the bass was immediately boomy but presonus had thought of that with controls adapting to your listening environment. my only gripe is the lack of xlr in although the jack ins are balanced so i had to make up a cable for it. i am absolutely delighted with these monitors, for the price, they sound fantastic.

Title: get them! the best budget speaker for true clarity in your music
Content: i've had a home studio now for a few years. regrettably, i had to sell a lot of my equipment last year, including my old monitors which were adam f5s. now i am slowly building up my home studio again from the bottom up. looking to get stuff on a budget and slowly upgrade bit by bit. after searching many reviews online about different monitors for a budget, i decided on these. what a great decision! i make house music and have had many chart entries on the digital stores, so i kinda know what i'm doing and these monitors are perfect for making music! can't believe the quality for the price. i wanted to have clarity and a flat, truthful sound. these give exactly that. i'm quite surprised at how loud they are for their size if i'm honest. even though that's not what i was after first and foremost. i can't recommend these enough, was a great decision. also i must report that i've got no hissing or humming issues that others have mentioned. can't wait to break these in properly and unlock their full potential.

Title: nice micro active speakers ruined by noisy electronics
Content: the good bits:..1- powerful amp capable of filling average size room..2-the speakers sound is strong, well balanced and puchy. both top and bottom ends are fairly weak, but i am comparing these to beyerdynamic dt990 headphones..3- easy setup as all connection leads for inputs and speaker connections supplied and power cable has a uk 3 pin plug...the bad bits:.sadly these active speakers have some major problems that makes them unusable in my opinion...1- the sound level left and right is not equal. sitting in the middle of a triangle with correct angle of facing the slave speaker is quieter than the main powered one..2- there is a a loud mains hum that breaks through. unfortunately, the power supply is part of the internal electronics, so we cant change it..3- strange popping and crackling sound seems to cut in and out..verdict:..the internal electronics appears to be badly designed and built, making these speakers unusable. reading other reviews, this is not a one off as the same complaints have been reported.i suspect this is either a bad batch, or they are simply not up to the mark.

Title: forward, unbalanced sound
Content: i so wanted to love these speakers, nearly everything about their design and sonic signature ticked all the boxes, other than the really forward upper midband around the crossover point (circa 2k-3k)...initially the forwardness makes the speakers sound bright and detailed, but in the long term this 'injected with adrenalin' presentation is artificial, fatiguing, and misguiding to mix with. you won't even realise you've subliminally compensated for their forwardness in the eq of your mixes until you play your music on more balanced speakers and wonder why your vocals and acoustic guitars sound recessed.Ôªø..i fully realise with speakers of this size and price it's about juggling compromises, but i know of ¬£30 single-driver bluetooth speakers which are nowhere near as good in absolute terms but which would be better to mix with because of their more natural tonal balance, so i can't help but feel the forward-leaning presentation of these speakers has been a deliberate design-choice to impress potential buyers in a-b in-store comparisons.
Clean Content: wanted love speakers, nearly everything design sonic signature ticked boxes, really forward upper midband around crossover point (circa 2k-3k)...initially forwardness makes speakers sound bright detailed, long term 'injected adrenalin' presentation artificial, fatiguing, misguiding mix with. won't even realise subliminally compensated forwardness eq mixes play music balanced speakers wonder vocals acoustic guitars sound recessed.Ôªø..i fully realise speakers size price juggling compromises, know ¬£30 single-driver bluetooth speakers nowhere near good absolute terms better mix natural tonal balance, can't help feel forward-leaning presentation speakers deliberate design-choice impress potential buyers a-b in-store comparisons.

Title: good sound, appalling mains hum
Content: i bought these to replace the e3.5 which were recalled due to a power fault. at first, i was really pleased. the sound was great for the money; excellent flat for studio monitors. but then i noted the hum. it's awful. you can hear it above the computer fan. i sometimes even appears on recordings if i'm doing voice overs at the desk. as others have said, it really let's down an otherwise great product. i was going to buy another pair as a replacement in the hole mine was a one off, but having just googled reviews, i'm not the only one to have this problem. i'd give them a wide birth now. that's two of this company's speakers in a row that have been critically flawed. that's pretty poor.

Title: good sound overall, but transformer/amp noise is disappointing
Content: so far on the first day, seems to be overall a decent set of speakers. well designed in general, seem well made and pretty solid overall. tonal balance is *really* nice for the size and price point; they're nearly as sweet as my much more expensive hifi speakers and amp downstairs. bass is pretty well controlled and tight, treble sparkly and detailed, and the mids clear and defined. the adjustments on the back make it easy to tweak for your particular circumstances - i had to trim the 'acoustic space' control down to -2db or else the bass was too boomy, which is exactly what the manual suggested would be right for the setup i have them in, close to a wall...however, as others have pointed out, there is a noticeable, although not completely awful, ac mains hum, more prominent in the left active speaker but audible in the right speaker too if you listen closely. also audible when not playing anything is a high-pitched amplifier hiss/white noise in both speakers. both the hum and the white noise seem to be the same level whatever the volume knob is set to, whatever is plugged into the mains, which socket it's plugged into, or whatever is plugged into the speakers, although the noise gets a bit louder if the powered speaker has been on for a while and is warm. so it seems that whatever's picking up the noise/hum is after the input stages/preamp - maybe the power amp stage is being pushed a bit hard and/or as others have said, the transformer is a bit cheap and is unshielded...i think i can live with the hum and noise, at least right now. it's not offensive and it's less noisy than some other powered speakers i've had, but for a pair of speakers that claim to be 'high-definition studio monitors' it's a bit disappointing. guess i'll just have to make sure i turn them off when i'm not playing things on them...also the package that turned up was the continental european version of the speakers with a two-prong europlug cable, which was another disappointment. fortunately i

Title: bad transformer hum
Content: having read lots of excellent online reviews i received these monitors with high expectations. i connected everything up and straight off listened to a variety of music just to check what others had been saying. must say that they sounded really good. but then when things were quiet...the dreaded low level hum. clearly audible over the fans of the computer. i disconnected all cables, the hum was still there. i then changed electrical sockets but the hum was still there. i hooked up my previous edifier monitors and they only had a slight hum which was barely noticeable and you had to put your ears near them to really hear it. then i read the amazon uk review by drew peacock from 4th september 2016 which highlighted the source of the problem. i then contacted the supplier who informed me that they had had several units returned because of the noisy transformer...so it looks as if presonus have lowered the quality of the electronics in the recent batches of these monitors, which is a great pity, because in all other respects they were really good for the price. i have returned them and will be looking for something else. if you are considering buying these monitors i suggest you check other recent online reviews that mention the transformer hum before you part with your cash and have the hassle of returning them.

Title: nice speakers, but a design flaw results in excessive mains hum in left speaker
Content: re the hum, actually i think you're underplaying it...it's really bad (especially in a quiet living room where the audible mains hum in the left speaker is intolerable). i have resolved the mains hum issue....but the solution is ugly...so, i bought a pair of secondhand eris e4.5 a couple of days ago off ebay ...& instantly noticed the hum in the main active speaker was terriblle. i therefore consulted the net & read of many reports of this hum (i therefore suspected design fault, vs. being sold a faulty pair of speakers). so being of a technical/electronics background, i dismantled the main speaker to get to the bottom of the hum ....alas, it's disappointing to report that i've concluded that the hum is a result of a major design fault by presonus (i can't believe this has actually slipped passed their q&a testing)...presonus have opted to save a few dollars by using a cheap mains transformer (vs. a better toroidal transformer). this cheap transformer spews out mains emf radiation internally within the left speaker enclosure....& because it's a small speaker this radiation gets physically induced into the main power supply via the very large heatsink (which sits alongside the transformer) & then the hum ends up in the signal path...i also believe there is some mains frequency 'magnetic coupling' going on between the mains transformer & the main lh speaker itself. the only way i could resolve (quickly & cheaply) was to extend the wires feeding the mains transformer & then relocate the mains transformer outside of the speaker enclosure (see the attached photo) it's a major hack (& looks awful - but won't be seen in my deployment), but at least my eris e4.5 speakers are totally hum free now...p.s. i initially thought that the audible hum was down to insufficient capacitance on the psu ...300mv (peak to peak) of ripple measured on there (presonus used a modest 4,700 capacitor on each of the two main psu rails), so i added in a further 10,000uf capacitance to each rail.
Clean Content: hum, actually think underplaying it...it's really bad (especially quiet living room audible mains hum left speaker intolerable). resolved mains hum issue....but solution ugly...so, bought pair secondhand eris e4.5 couple days ago ebay ...& instantly noticed hum main active speaker terriblle. therefore consulted net & read many reports hum (i therefore suspected design fault, vs. sold faulty pair speakers). technical/electronics background, dismantled main speaker get bottom hum ....alas, disappointing report i've concluded hum result major design fault presonus (i can't believe actually slipped passed q&a testing)...presonus opted save dollars using cheap mains transformer (vs. better toroidal transformer). cheap transformer spews mains emf radiation internally within left speaker enclosure....& small speaker radiation gets physically induced main power supply via large heatsink (which sits alongside transformer) & hum ends signal path...i also believe mains frequency 'magnetic coupling' going mains transformer & main lh speaker itself. way resolve (quickly & cheaply) extend wires feeding mains transformer & relocate mains transformer outside speaker enclosure (see attached photo) major hack (& looks awful - won't seen deployment), least eris e4.5 speakers totally hum free now...p.s. initially thought audible hum insufficient capacitance psu ...300mv (peak peak) ripple measured (presonus used modest 4,700 capacitor two main psu rails), added 10,000uf capacitance rail.

Title: great little speakers
Content: great speakers... really compact, yet with a beautiful, balanced sound. wide range of connections, including bluetooth connectivity. they also have a basic "equalizer" (high/low), but the sound is so good that i didn't even touch it. with my previous speakers, from a famous german low-cost brand, i couldn't achieve a decent sound no matter how i set them, though they were advertised as monitor speakers..highly recommended and well worth the price.

Title: i bought these speakers at the beginning of jan 2016 ...
Content: i bought these speakers at the beginning of jan 2016 and thought the sound was ok (not as special as i was expecting). there was some background 'hum' and buzzing and after a week they just wouldn't power up one morning. i checked fuses which were all ok. no idea what could possibly have gone wrong. i reported it to amazon and was offered a full refund but i'd rather have had a working set of speakers..on the plus side, there's loads of connections and build quality felt good.

Title: presonus eris e4.5 - 25w active (pair) 4.5...
Content: these speakers are absolutely brilliant..superb build quality and sound..we have them hooked up to the tv; they really come into their own with music, but are just as good for normal tv dialogue..i also use the 3.5mm jack input for mp3, phone, tablet, whatever; superb sound, more than enough volume..clear treble, no harshness, the bass end is great too; will provide a good deep bass that is never muddy..adjustments for sound delivery; to tune to your taste..pretty impressive units for size and cost. highly recommended.

Title: bargain price! a great deal!
Content: these are a snatch at this price. needed a set of monitors for mixing and recording on, but the space is only my bedroom and fairly small..build quality on these is brilliant. sound is great and can be tweaked nicely. front headphone output and in are nice, standard inputs at back..overall a great purchase, definitely worth the money. perform just as well as many higher priced speakers. unless you're going to spend a good few times more on monitors, these are probably the best you can get, and certainly best value for money.

Title: at this price, an absolute steal!
Content: great speakers. nice bass, mid and treble. my first monitor speakers, and very, very pleased. hooked up to my pc, and i can no listen to all my tunes without any distortion. got some audio foam for the base, just to limit any rattling, none at all. brilliant, and at the price they are now, ¬£116, an absolute steal. even at top price, people were saying these speakers give great value for money. just over ¬£50 for each speaker is the bargain of the year!

Title: awesome monitors, everything i wanted in a pair of miniature powered speakers
Content: these monitors are a revelation!..everything i wanted in a miniature monitor is basically provided: sounds pop out of the speakers in a three-dimensional way, there is crisp and clean treble, clear and realistic mid-range, and a very reasonable amount of bass for the size. stereo imaging is good, and i have not found them at all fatiguing to listen to...as with most other ported designs, in an untreated room at close proximity to walls, i find it's best to roll off the bass with one of the "low cutoff" settings at the back (80 hz or 100 hz). but even at 80 hz, there is still an adequate amount of bass produced for most scenarios, and what is there sounds tight and controlled...sometimes i've heard details on these monitors that i never noticed before when listening to the same music on larger, much more expensive monitors. i suspect that's partly due simply to the size of the cabinets - i suspect smaller speakers are going to exhibit less masking of mid-range elements by bass sounds; or maybe it's due to a higher crossover frequency. i'm not sure. but it's also a testament to how good these monitors are. given the price, they are amazing...i have the monitors placed high up, so they're slightly above head level, tilted downwards so they're pointing directly at my head in normal sitting position. i find this sounds much better than putting them low down at desk level and tilting them upwards, presumably because there are less reflections off the desk itself...i did this by placing a pair of pixel t50 speaker stands (50cm tall, costing ¬£50) on my desk, just behind my displays - the stands are the perfect height to hold the monitors so their front faces are just above my displays. i then used a pair of foam isolation pads to rest the monitors on and tilt them downwards at the right angle. for this i used a pair of adam hall pad eco series absorber plates, which are the right width for these monitors.
Clean Content: monitors revelation!..everything wanted miniature monitor basically provided: sounds pop speakers three-dimensional way, crisp clean treble, clear realistic mid-range, reasonable amount bass size. stereo imaging good, not found fatiguing listen to...as ported designs, untreated room close proximity walls, find best roll bass one "low cutoff" settings back (80 hz 100 hz). even 80 hz, still adequate amount bass produced scenarios, sounds tight controlled...sometimes i've heard details monitors never noticed listening music larger, much expensive monitors. suspect that's partly due simply size cabinets - suspect smaller speakers going exhibit less masking mid-range elements bass sounds; maybe due higher crossover frequency. i'm not sure. also testament good monitors are. given price, amazing...i monitors placed high up, they're slightly head level, tilted downwards they're pointing directly head normal sitting position. find sounds much better putting low desk level tilting upwards, presumably less reflections desk itself...i placing pair pixel t50 speaker stands (50cm tall, costing ¬£50) desk, behind displays - stands perfect height hold monitors front faces displays. used pair foam isolation pads rest monitors tilt downwards right angle. used pair adam hall pad eco series absorber plates, right width monitors.

Title: great budget monitors but check voltage selector before plugging in!
Content: excellent buy. go great with my presonus studio 1 and firebox. i had been mixing via headphones and hi fi speakers. the monitors make a world of difference. one caveat the manual says that voltage selector on the speakers will be set to that of the country where purchased mine wasn't and needed changing - make sure you check it to avoid a blown fuse - or worse!. also came with the wrong power lead. although annoying, for the price, these are still worth five stars.

Title: fantastic, clear sound in a very compact package
Content: fantastic, clear sound in a very compact package. that being said, i do get a tiny bit of (mains?) hum from them, and (as other reviewers have noticed) they're not 100% screened against external interference - they will occasionally pickup my mobile, possibly over the speaker cable link to the passive speaker..but the sound is excellent, great bass for a set this size, and the build quality is rock solid.
